snippet: The departing Chinese leader, Hu Jintao, has made it clear that he has little interest in the bold changes that many Chinese now see as long overdue.
abstract: Chinese leader Hu Jintao is expected to step down and cede power to his successor Xi Jinping, but has made it clear that he does not support reforms and changes to status quo that many Chinese see as long overdue; Xi has been consulting with liberal members of Chinese intelligentsia, but has not indicated that he opposes Hu's direction and may be too constrained by political structures to change it (Series: Changing of the Guard).

byline.original: By IAN JOHNSON and KEITH BRADSHER

lead_paragraph: The departing Chinese leader, Hu Jintao, has made it clear that he has little interest in the bold changes that many Chinese now see as long overdue.

headline.seo: Hu Jintao Tries to Cement Legacy Opposing Change
headline.main: On Way Out, China’s Leader Offers Praise for the Status Quo
headline.print_headline: On Way Out, China’s Leader Offers Support To Status Quo
